intro: Argostemma separatum, commonly known as the slender argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are typically clustered in cymes, and it produces small, spherical berries. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
